image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born near Chatfield, Fillmore County, Minn., on March 12, 1866; attended the country schools, and was graduated from Winona (Minn.) Normal School in 1886; taught school for two years at Graceville, Minn.; attended the law department of the University of Wisconsin at Madison and was graduated from the law department of the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis in 1889; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced practice in St. Paul, Minn.; moved to Lincoln, Lancaster County, Nebr., in 1895 and continued the practice of his profession; moved to Minneapolis, Minn., in 1905 and practiced law until 1912; elected as a Republican to the Sixty-third Congress (March 4, 1913-March 3, 1915); was not a candidate for renomination in 1914; resumed the practice of law; died in St. Paul, Minn., January 8, 1932; interment in Calvary Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Manahan, James. Trials of a lawyer. Minneapolis: Fainham Printing and Stationary Co., 1933.

researchRecord.name: 1880-1937, 5.5 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of James Manahan include correspondence, diaries (1896-1897), a draft of his autobiography, account books, law practice files, and scrapbooks. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Equity Cooperative Exchange Papers, 1906-1929, 1.5 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include James Manahan. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Luth and Nanny Mattson Jaeger Papers, 1874-1933, 1.7 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include James Manahan. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the National Nonpartisan League Papers, 1915-1927, 18 microfim reels.
In the George Loper Nevius Papers, ca. 1884-1915, 0.75 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include James Manahan. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.
